author: Michael Larabel
description: ZLUDA Version 5-preview.43 was released today as this open-source CUDA implementation for use on non-NVIDIA GPUs, with one of the current focuses being on enabling CUDA on AMD Radeon GPUs with ROCm...
title: New ZLUDA 5 Preview Released For CUDA On Non-NVIDIA GPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last week I published fresh benchmarks showing how AMD's EPYC 4005 series for budget servers can outperform the original EPYC 7601 flagship processor when EPYC first launched during the Zen 1 period. Even with lower core counts and fewer memory channels, the modern EPYC 4005 "Grado" processors were able to outpace that original EPYC "Naples" flagship processor from 2017. With carrying out the fresh re-testing of the AMD EPYC 7601 on a modern 2025 Linux software stack, in today's article is a look at how the EPYC 7601 Zen 1 performance compares to the EPYC 9005 "Turin" series with today's flagship EPYC 9755 and EPYC 9965 processors.
title: AMD's Epic Performance Gains From The Original EPYC 7601 To EPYC 9755 / EPYC 9965

author: Michael Larabel
description: Red Hat this morning went public with RHEL for Business Developers, an expansion of their RHEL Developer Program to make it easier for business developers to make use of Red Hat Enterprise Linux at no-cost for their development efforts...
title: Red Hat Announces No-Cost RHEL For Business Developers

author: Michael Larabel
description: Miracle-WM 0.6 is out today as a mega release for this Mir-based Wayland compositor by Canonical/Ubuntu developer Matthew Kosarek. Miracle-WM provides tiling window manager support inspired by i3 and Sway while being one of the most pronounced users of the Mir code...
title: Miracle-WM 0.6 Brings Many Improvements For This Mir-Based Wayland Compositor

author: Michael Larabel
description: Intel discontinued Graphics Virtualization Technology (GVT-G) support several generations ago in favor of supporting SR-IOV for graphics virtualization with Iris Xe and newer integrated/discrete graphics hardware. But with the transition as well from the Linux i915 to Xe kernel graphics drivers, the official SR-IOV support state on Intel graphics is in a bit of an awkward state...
title: Intel SR-IOV Support Ready For Panther Lake Graphics But Some Current Platforms Left Behind

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Mesa 25.2 code is expected to be branched next week to kick off the release process for this quarter's iteration of open-source OpenGL and Vulkan drivers. As such, there's going to be a mad dash over the next week to land lingering features and other improvements for Mesa 25.2. Making it into Mesa Git today was a big set of 42 patches for the Imagination PowerVR Vulkan driver...
title: PowerVR Vulkan Driver Enhancements Merged Ahead Of Mesa 25.2

author: Michael Larabel
description: Google yesterday lifted the lid on their work around Skia "Graphite" as a new rasterization back-end designed for modern graphics APIs like Vulkan and supporting multi-threading by default. Skia Graphite aims to deliver much better performance within the Chrome/Chromium web browser...
title: Google Developing Skia "Graphite" For Faster Chrome: Multi-Threaded + Modern Graphics APUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Microsoft released Azure Linux 3.0.20250702 on Tuesday as the newest monthly update to this in-house Linux distribution used throughout the company and by external parties...
title: Microsoft's Azure Linux 3.0.20250702 Brings Many Security Fixes

author: Michael Larabel
description: The first alpha release of PHP 8.5 was issued last week in kicking off the release cycle in working toward the official PHP 8.5.0 release later in the year...
title: PHP 8.5 Alpha 1 Released With New Features
